data.title: Taylor Swift albums in order - Taylor's Versions and first albums
data.meta_description: Take a deep dive into the singer's extensive discography.
data.text:
Post Malone and Florence Welch from Florence + The Machine both feature on the album, in leading track Fortnight and in Florida!!! respectively.

Swift announced the arrival of the album at the Grammys earlier this year, while receiving her 13th award.

"I want to say thank you to the fans by telling you a secret I've been keeping from you for the last two years," she said. "Which is that my brand new album comes out April 19. It's called The Tortured Poets Department."

More like this

Before the announcements, fans had speculated that she would announce a release date for her re-recording of Reputation, one of two studio albums left to re-release under the 'Taylor's Version' banner (her first studio album, Taylor Swift, is also pending re-release).

Last October, Swift re-released 1989 (Taylor's Version), marking the fourth album she has re-recorded from her back catalogue.

Beyond her re-releases, the 12-time Grammy Award winner has a prolific discography and has released 14 albums. But when did they each come out and in what order? Read on to find out. Plus, did you know you can watch The Era's Tour on Disney Plus right now?

Get Disney Plus from £4.99 per month

Taylor Swift albums in release order

This list includes Swift's albums by order of release, from her self-titled debut to global hit Midnights. For her own versions so far, scroll down.

Taylor Swift (2006)

Fearless (2008)

Speak Now (2010)

Red (2012)

1989 (2014)

Reputation (2017)

Lover (2019)

Folklore (2020)

Evermore (2020)

Midnights (2022)

The Tortured Poets Department (2024)

Swift also released the following official live albums:

Speak Now World Tour – Live (2011)

Live from Clear Channel Stripped 2008 (2020)

Folklore: The Long Pond Studio Sessions, from the Disney+ Special (2020)

Lover (Live from Paris) (2023)

Taylor Swift albums (Taylor's Version) in release order

Currently, Swift has re-recorded three of her studio albums, with 1989 announced as the fourth in August 2023 and Reputation expected to follow in the future.

Fearless (Taylor's Version) (2021)

Red (Taylor's Version) (2021)

Speak Now (Taylor's Version) (2023)

1989 (Taylor's Version) (2023)

Taylor Swift: The Eras Tour (Taylor’s Version) is available to stream on Disney Plus from, take a look at our Disney Plus deal page for more.

If you fancy treating yourself to some special edition Taylor vinyls, as well as other gifts and merch, take a look at our roundup of the best gifts for Taylor Swift fans.
